keyword: how many calories in grilled chicken
title: How Many Calories in Grilled Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in grilled chicken per 100g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition breakdowns for easy tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in Grilled Chicken?
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast, grilled without added oil or marinade; standard portion.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, size, cooking method, seasonings, and added fats. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of grilled chicken breast provides about 165 kcal and 31g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Marinated in oil-based sauce (1 tsp oil per 100g)
Thigh meat instead of breast (higher fat per 100g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g grilled chicken?
faqs.a: About 165 kcal for skinless breast, grilled plain.

faqs.q: Is grilled chicken high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 100g provides ~31g protein, ideal for muscle building.

faqs.q: Does grilling add calories to chicken?
faqs.a: No, if no oil is used; it can reduce fat compared to frying.

faqs.q: What about carbs in grilled chicken?
faqs.a: Negligibleâ€”0g carbs per 100g for plain grilled breast.

faqs.q: How does chicken thigh compare in calories?
faqs.a: Higher at ~190 kcal per 100g due to more fat content.
